skills.name: Find the prime factor decomposition of a number in non-index form

explanations.B: This is the correct tree. All calculations are correct and each factor is prime.
explanations.C: Almost, but 117 isn't prime. It is in the 3 times table

explanations.A: Almost, but 9 is not prime so can be broken down further
explanations.B: Not quite, 225 is not 5 x 75, it is 5 x 45
explanations.C: Not quite, both 9 and 25 are not prime and so can be broken down further
explanations.D: We have 225 ÷ 3 = 75, 75 ÷ 5 = 15, and then 15 ÷ 5 = 3. Then all of the numbers are prime.

explanations.A: A prime factor of 18 is a number that will go into 18 and is also prime. Both 2 and 9 are factors of 18 but only 2 is prime. Therefore Tom is correct but Katie is incorrect.
explanations.B: Not quite. Remember a prime number is a number that has exactly two factors.
explanations.C: Not quite. Remember a prime number is a number that has exactly two factors.
explanations.D: Not quite at least one of them is correct. Remember a prime number is a number that has exactly 2 factors. How many factors does 9 have? How many factors does 2 have?

explanations.A: Not quite. Remember a prime number is a number that has two distinct (different) factors.
explanations.B: A prime factor of 24 is a number that will go into 24 and is also prime. Both 1 and 2 are factors of 24 but only 2 is prime. Therefore only Paul is correct.
explanations.C: Not quite. Remember a prime number is a number that has two distinct (different) factors.
explanations.D: Not quite. At least one of them is correct. Remember a prime number is a number that has two distinct (different) factors.

explanations.A: Be careful. This is a factor tree. It splits a number into factor pairs (numbers which divide 48), you appear to have subtracted instead. 45 is NOT a factor of 48.
explanations.B: Be careful. This is a factor tree. It splits a number into factor pairs (numbers which divide 48). 144 is a multiple of 48: 3 x 48 = 144.
explanations.C: Be careful. This is a factor tree. It splits a number into factor pairs. Despite both being factors of 48, 3 and 24 do not form a factor pair because 3x24 = 72.
explanations.D: The numbers at the end of the branches of a factor tree will multiply to give the number at the top: 3 ✕ ? = 48, giving ? = 16.

explanations.A: The numbers at the end of the branches of a factor tree will multiply to give the number at the top: 3 ✕ ? = 24, giving ? = 8.
explanations.B: Be careful. This is a factor tree. It splits a number into factor pairs. Despite both being factors of 24, 3 and 12 do not form a factor pair because 3x12 = 36.
explanations.C: Be careful. This is a factor tree. It splits a number into factor pairs (numbers which divide 24). You appear to have subtracted instead.
explanations.D: Be careful. This is a factor tree. It splits a number into factor pairs (numbers which divide 24). 72 is a multiple of 24: 3 x 24=72

explanations.A: This is a good first step, but you cannot stop just yet as 4 and 10 are not prime numbers. Can you split this into prime numbers?
explanations.C: 40 = 4 ✕ 10. Neither of these is prime, but 4 = 2 ✕ 2 and 10 = 5 ✕ 2, and all these factors are prime, so putting this together gives 40 = 2 ✕ 2 ✕ 2 ✕ 5.
explanations.D: Be careful. 1 is not a prime number, and 1 x 1 = 1 NOT 2.

explanations.A: Be careful. 1 is not a prime number.
explanations.C: This is a good first step, but you cannot stop just yet as 6 and 10 are not prime numbers. Can you split these into prime numbers?
explanations.D: 60 = 6 ✕ 10. Neither of these is prime, but 6 = 2 ✕ 3 and 10 = 5 ✕ 2, and all these factors are prime, so putting this together gives 60 = 2 ✕ 3 ✕ 2 ✕ 5.

explanations.A: 45 = 9 x 5, but 9 can be broken down further so would need another set of branches
explanations.B: 47 is prime so it would only have 47 on its own
explanations.C: Almost, but we are told that a and b have to be different
explanations.D: 51 = 3 x 17, so this would be the complete factor tree.

explanations.A: 30 = 2 x 15, but then 15 can be broken down so it would need some more branches
explanations.B: 31 is prime, so we can't draw a prime factor tree like this - it would only have the ? at the top
explanations.C: 33 = 3 x 11, so it only has 2 prime factors. This would fit into the prime factor tree
explanations.D: Almost, but 25 = 5 x 5 and we are told that a and b are different
